thread.title: Looking for a fairy floss hot dog? The Texas Rangers can help you
thread.title_full: Looking for a fairy floss hot dog? The Texas Rangers can help you

title: Looking for a fairy floss hot dog? The Texas Rangers can help you
text:
Fusion: The Texas Rangers' latest concession stand offering. Photo: Twitter
If you've ever spent time in the US, you'd know that the American diet has a unique propensity for mixing sweet and savoury.
Maple syrup-covered omelettes. Chocolate covered bacon. Any way to ruin a decent meal with loads of fructose is considered plausible.
But even by American standards, baseball's Texas Rangers have pushed the boundary with the newest addition to their game-day menu.
To celebrate their qualification for the playoffs after clinching the American League West - and perhaps in an effort to trump the heart disease-inducing offerings introduced at some football stadiums this season - the Rangers have released some intriguing concession-stand items that defy all rules of culinary decency.
Advertisement Heading the list of sugar-coated madness is the 'sweet spot candy dog' which - and it's hard to even write this - features a hot dog drowned in cotton candy-infused mustard and cotton candy. Cotton candy is the American name for fairy floss.
Other insane menu introductions include the Elvis Jabberdog Brownie: a 60-centimetre brownie rolled in a Rice Krispy crust, dipped in cake batter, fried and topped, of course, with whipped cream.
There is also the the "One-Pound Top-N-Go Cheetos," a half-kilogram bag of Cheetos opened on its side and loaded with taco meat and topped with nacho cheese on offer for those with a strong constitution.
New @Rangers games: Hot dog w/mac & cheese or mashed potatoes, topped w/brisket, chili or shredded chicken pic.twitter.com/5U5f5sQhXf
— Darren Rovell (@darrenrovell) October 5, 2015 For Postseason Home Games: The @Rangers will sell a hot dog w/cotton candy-infused mustard, topped w/cotton candy pic.twitter.com/No7V4iufdC
— Darren Rovell (@darrenrovell) October 5, 2015 New for @Rangers games: A 2-foot long brownie in Rice Krispies crust, dipped in funnel cake batter & fried pic.twitter.com/usiE9n9AEY
— Darren Rovell (@darrenrovell) October 5, 2015
